article_title: Man arrested for alleged kidnapping attempt at Salina Walmart
article_text:
A man was arrested for allegedly pulling a knife on a woman and trying to force her into a Walmart bathroom in Salina.

The incident happened around 4:30 a.m. Friday at the Walmart at 2900 South 9th Street. Police tell KSAL a 42-year-old woman was in the store when a man approached her and pulled a knife. When the man reportedly pulled her toward a restroom, the woman pulled away and screamed.

Police say the suspect punched the woman and started to run from the store. He also threatened a Walmart manager with the knife.

Witnesses gave officers a description of the suspect’s vehicle. Officers later found the car and the suspect at a home in the 1300 block of Crescent, KSAL reports.

The suspect is identified as 31-year-old Jerrid Logan of Delphos. He was booked for aggravated kidnapping, aggravated battery, aggravated assault and possession of meth.
